properties.name: MTubie
properties.description:
(MimeTubie )An open source PNGTuber template you can use to create custom PNGTuber models using Visual-Scripting (Event sheet). You can make either Tweened or import frame by frame animations!

You Got Frame by frame (FBF) and Tweening Scenes as template to what you can do. It is easy to use. Enjoy your time.
(Make sure to read the comments in the code ^^)

Special thanks to : 
- Arthuro (For making the Microphone extension)
- VictrisGames (For making the ShakeObject extension)

objects.name: Info
objects.string:
Check the Events for the code!

(This text will be hidden upon start)

events.comment:
Hello!, this is the code for scene. This is where the character is given commands to do stuff!

A small intro : 
The comments made in this project are for both beginners, people who just used Gdevelop for the first time and people wanting to understand what is the function for each thing!
I hope you don't mind how detailed it is ^^

-Click on the arrows beside the event groups to open them
-If you find any code that is crossed, right-click it and click "Toggle disabled". This works if you want to enable or disable your code
-If you have any problems with the code, make sure to check Gdevelop's official youtube channel! " https://www.youtube.com/@GDevelopApp "

The Scene on top will always start first, make sure if you will use the frame by frame one, make sure it is the top one
Make sure to check the sprites from the editor itself. Double click on the sprites in the "Object" Tab to check them out!
You can ofc remove all the tweens if you just want a still image with no movement
Final note (for now lol), If you want to make a "pixel" character, make sure to go to properties and click on the "Round pixels" and set the scaling to "Nearest"

This is the first code that gets excuted when starting the scene for the first time. This means it won't run again unless you restarted the whole scene.
This is very important since it will be used to start all the tweens and have the initial actions you need/ want to run at first!

-Also, the "WholeHead" is a group that contains parts of the head, this can be helpful to animate parts all in one code. However, it is better if these parts had the same canvas size (no matter their size), so they all move together the exact same)

This is a basic and really easy way to tween your character. However, if you want to make things move at different times, it is better to make different code for them
When the tween finishes, the other plays and when the other finishes, the first plays, like that, it is all in a smooth loop!
This is a timer that is set to a random window frame between 2 to 6 seconds (will randomly choose, let's say, second number 3 and then the action will get excuted)
After the animation of the eyes blinking finishes, it will go back to being set to eyes open

This code checks if your sound/ voice input in the microphone is high enough to a certain point. If the sound is higher than the number set, the mouth opens. If it is even higher, the mouth opens more. If it is lower, the mouth closes

If you don't have more than one monitor, make sure to use/ enable this code below. 
What it does it that it makes the model always on the top of the screen and position it at the far bottom right of the screen. 
This way, the model is still working and hidden off the screen!

This is the current way I was able to find for now. If someone contributed and helped me with this issue. I will be very thankful! lol

In here, the code is very similar to the first example, the only difference is that you don't really need to animate much (unless you wanted to add something new)
The animation will mostly depend on the microphone if everything was included together. Ofc, you can separate some parts of the body to have a hybrid between FBF and Tweening!

This is the first code that gets excuted when starting the scene for the first time. This means it won't run again unless you restarted the whole scene.
This is very important since it will be used to start all the tweens and have the initial actions you need/ want to run at first!

-Also, the "WholeHead" is a group that contains parts of the head, this can be helpful to animate parts all in one code. However, it is better if these parts had the same canvas size (no matter their size), so they all move together the exact same)
You can add the shouting animation if you want, I already demonstrated how it works in the other scene, and shaking too!

This code checks if your sound/ voice input in the microphone is high enough to a certain point. If the sound is higher than the number set, the mouth opens. If it is even higher, the mouth opens more. If it is lower, the mouth closes

If you don't have more than one monitor, make sure to use/ enable this code below. 
What it does it that it makes the model always on the top of the screen and position it at the far bottom right of the screen. 
This way, the model is still working and hidden off the screen!

This is the current way I was able to find for now. If someone contributed and helped me with this issue. I will be very thankful! lol

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Arthur Pacaud (arthuro555)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Microphone
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: Adds a set of tool to make your game interract with the players microphone

eventsFunctions.description: Requests an access to the microphone.
eventsFunctions.name: requestMicrophoneAccess

inlineCode: // this will have no effect, since we don't copy the input to the output,
// but works around a current Chrome bug.
// Do a root-mean-square on the samples: sum up the squares...
// ... then take the square root of the sum.
// Now smooth this out with the averaging factor applied
// to the previous sample - take the max here because we

eventsFunctions.description: Triggers once when the access to the microphone has been denied.
eventsFunctions.name: micDenied

eventsFunctions.description: Triggers once when the access to the microphone has been granted.
eventsFunctions.name: micGranted

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ShakeObject
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle, scale).
description: Select one or more methods of shaking:
- Position: Shake the X and/or Y position of the object
- Angle: Shake the angle (rotation) of the object
- Scale: Shake the scale of the object (must be a sprite)
- Amplitude: How far the object moves during each shake
- Duration: Amount of time to shake the object
- Time between shakes: Amount of time between each movement of the object
- For a single-shake effect, set the "Time between shakes" to be equal to "Duration"  (great for a hit or impact)
- To make the single-shake move in the opposite direction, use negative numbers
- To repeat a single-shake effect in a loop, add a condition "Object is not shaking"
- Use a long "Time between shakes" to simulate a slow moving object (like a ship rocking back and forth)
- Make sure to "Stop shaking" before starting a new shake if it uses different parameters.
- Use "Shake until stopped" to simulate engine vibration, earthquake, or pulsing

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle).
This behavior can be used on any type of object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngle

eventsFunctions.description: Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle).
eventsFunctions.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngle
eventsFunctions.sentence: Shake object _PARAM0_ for _PARAM2_ seconds. Modify position amplitude _PARAM3_ on X axis and _PARAM4_ on Y axis, angle rotation amplitude _PARAM5_.  Wait _PARAM6_ seconds between shakes. Keep shaking until stopped: _PARAM7_

events.comment: Pass input parameters to global variables so that onScenePostEvents can use them
Determine if the shake should keep going until stopped
Add default values if none were provided
If duration is less than a single shake, increase duration to make 1 full shake

parameters.description: Amplitude of postion shake in X direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerX

parameters.description: Amplitude of position shake in Y direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerY

parameters.description: Amplitude of angle rotation shake (in degrees)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerAngle

parameters.description: Amount of time between shakes (in seconds) (Default: 0.08)
parameters.name: TimeBetweenShakes

events.comment: Run once before every shake movement

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
Make initial shake NOT random so users can set a direction for a one-shake effect
After initial shake pick a random direction
Save that initial shake has been processed
Calculate the fraction of shake that occured during this frame
Increase change for the first half of the shake (move away from original values)
Decrease change the second half of the shake (return to original position)
Stop shaking when the duration has been reached (or if the stop shaking function was called)

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake

eventsFunctions.description: Stop any shaking of object that was initiated by the Shake Object extension.
eventsFunctions.name: StopShaking

eventsFunctions.description: Check if an object is shaking.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Check if an object is shaking
eventsFunctions.name: IsShaking

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle, scale)
This behavior can only be used on sprite objects.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngleScale

eventsFunctions.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngleScale
eventsFunctions.sentence: Shake object _PARAM0_ for _PARAM2_ seconds. Modify position amplitude _PARAM3_ on X axis and _PARAM4_ on Y axis, angle rotation amplitude _PARAM5_, and scale amplitude _PARAM6_.  Wait _PARAM7_ seconds between shakes.  Keep shaking until stopped: _PARAM8_

events.comment: Pass input parameters to global variables so that onScenePostEvents can use them
Determine if the shake should keep going until stopped
Add default values if none were provided
If duration is less than a single shake, increase duration to make 1 full shake

parameters.description: Amplitude of postion shake in X direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerX

parameters.description: Amplitude of position shake in Y direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerY

parameters.description: Amplitude of angle rotation shake (in degrees)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerAngle

parameters.description: Amplitude of scale shake (in percent change)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerScale

parameters.description: Amount of time between shakes (in seconds) (Default: 0.08)
parameters.name: TimeBetweenShakes

events.comment: Run once before every shake movement

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
Make initial shake NOT random so users can set a direction for a one-shake effect
After initial shake pick a random direction
Calculate object scale displacement, with linear decay over time
Save that initial shake has been processed
Calculate the fraction of shake that occured during this frame
Increase change for the first half of the shake (move away from original values)
Decrease change the second half of the shake (return to original position)
Stop shaking when the duration has been reached (or if the stop shaking function was called)

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
